fields_of_interest: Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Enlargement, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, External Relations
eu_initiatives: The initiatives that we follow most intensively are those of the Accession Talks with the Western Balkan countries and those of the External Action Service where it relates to minority rights, development and rule of law. We also follow the AFET and DROI committees.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
persons_accredited_for_access_to_europea: ABAZI#Redzep, ALIU#Ali, BEN CHELOUCH#Shai, BENDAJ#Bledar, LATO#Fatjon, LATO#Festim, MARING#Markwin, NTOUXIS#Thodoris, OMERI#Muamet, PRIFTI#Andrelini, REYES VILLAGRAN#Jose Ramon, SAPIOPER#Simon, SOEDERHUIZEN#Bob, ZANDBERG#Jeroen
relevant_communication: At this moment (February 2018) our organisation is actively following the Accession Talks with possible new members in the Western Balkans. We have met many European Parliamentarians (MEP's) in the past few months to inform them of the situation of minority groups in the region. Furthermore, we have been in contact, in person, by telephone and by e-mail, with representatives from the Commission relating to these matters. We are also following the general activities of the External Action Service for several of the other minority groups who we support. We also follow the AFET and DROI committees closely. We are at least two days per week in Brussels to attend conferences, meet with representatives of the parliament or the commission and NGO representatives. We are currently also working on a conference in cooperation with an MEP that will be held at the EP.
